auth_config.name: api_key
auth_config.label: API Key
auth_config.message: This API key will be used for accessing the service.

id.text: The unique identifier of your transcription

audio_url.text: The URL of the audio or video file to transcribe.

punctuate.text: Enable Automatic Punctuation, can be true or false.

redact_pii.text: Redact PII from the transcribed text using the Redact PII model, can be true or false.

word_boost.text: The list of custom vocabulary to boost transcription probability for.

format_text.text: Enable Text Formatting, can be true or false

webhook_url.text: The URL to which we send webhook requests. We sends two different types of webhook requests. One request when a transcript is completed or failed, and one request when the redacted audio is ready if redact_pii_audio is enabled.

audio_end_at.text: The point in time, in milliseconds, to stop transcribing in your media file

disfluencies.text: Transcribe Filler Words, like “umm”, in your media file; can be true or false

dual_channel.text: Deprecated: Enable Dual Channel transcription, can be true or false.

multichannel.text: Enable Multichannel transcription, can be true or false.

speech_model.text: The speech model to use for the transcription.

auto_chapters.text: Enable Auto Chapters, can be true or false

custom_topics.text: Enable custom topics, either true or false

language_code.text: The language of your audio file. Possible values are found in Supported Languages. The default value is ‘en_us’.

summarization.text: Enable Summarization, can be true or false.

summary_model.text: The model to summarize the transcript.

content_safety.text: Enable Content Moderation, can be true or false

iab_categories.text: Enable Topic Detection, can be true or false

redact_pii_sub.text: The replacement logic for detected PII, can be 'entity_name' or 'hash'.

speaker_labels.text: Enable Speaker diarization, can be true or false.

auto_highlights.text: Enable Key Phrases, either true or false

custom_spelling.text: Customize how words are spelled and formatted using to and from values

audio_start_from.text: Returns transcripts that were created before a specific transcript ID

entity_detection.text: Enable Entity Detection, can be true or false

filter_profanity.text: Filter profanity from the transcribed text, can be true or false

redact_pii_audio.text: Generate a copy of the original media file with spoken PII 'beeped' out, can be true or false.

speech_threshold.text: Reject audio files that contain less than this fraction of speech. Valid values are in the range [0, 1] inclusive.

speakers_expected.text: Tells the speaker label model how many speakers it should attempt to identify, up to 10.

language_detection.text: Enable Automatic language detection, either true or false.

sentiment_analysis.text: Enable Sentiment Analysis, can be true or false.

redact_pii_policies.text: The list of PII Redaction policies to enable.

redact_pii_audio_quality.text: Controls the filetype of the audio created by redact_pii_audio. Currently supports mp3 (default) and wav.

webhook_auth_header_name.text: The header name to be sent with the transcript completed or failed webhook requests.

content_safety_confidence.text: The confidence threshold for the Content Moderation model. Values must be between 25 and 100.

webhook_auth_header_value.text: The header value to send back with the transcript completed or failed webhook requests for added security.

language_confidence_threshold.text: The confidence threshold for the automatically detected language. An error will be returned if the language confidence is below this threshold. Defaults to 0.

meta.description: Create a transcript from a media file that is accessible via a URL.
Get the transcript resource. The transcript is ready when the “status” is “completed”.

limit.text: Maximum amount of transcripts to retrieve.

after_id.text: Get transcripts that were created after this transcript ID.

before_id.text: Get transcripts that were created before this transcript ID.

created_on.text: Only get transcripts created on this date.

throttled_only.text: Only get throttled transcripts, overrides the status filter.

meta.description: Retrieve a list of transcripts you created. Transcripts are sorted from newest to oldest. The previous URL always points to a page with older transcripts.
Get the transcript split by sentences. The API will attempt to semantically segment the transcript into sentences to create more reader-friendly transcripts.

id.text: The unique identifier of your transcription

meta.description: Export your completed transcripts in SRT (srt) or VTT (vtt) format, which can be used for subtitles and closed captions in videos.
If you enable PII redaction, get the redacted audio, as described in the Create a redacted audio file section.

id.text: The unique identifier of your transcription

meta.description: Optionally, after your transcript is complete, get the paragraphs using its id.
Upload a media file to AssemblyAI’s servers.
Search through the transcript for keywords. You can search for individual words, numbers, or phrases containing up to five words or numbers.

prompt.text: Your text to prompt the model to produce a desired output, including any context you want to pass into the model.

input_text.text: Custom formatted transcript data. Maximum size is the context limit of the selected model, which defaults to 100000.

final_model.text: The model that is used for the final prompt after compression is performed.

temperature.text: The temperature to use for the model. Higher values result in answers that are more creative, lower values are more conservative.

transcript_ids.text: A list of completed transcripts with text. Up to a maximum of 100 files or 100 hours, whichever is lower.

max_output_size.text: Defaults to 2000. Max output size in tokens.

meta.description: Use the LeMUR task endpoint to input your own LLM prompt.

input_text.text: Custom formatted transcript data. Maximum size is the context limit of the selected model

final_model.text: The model that is used for the final prompt after compression is performed.

temperature.text: The temperature to use for the model. Higher values result in answers that are more creative, lower values are more conservative.

transcript_ids.text: A list of completed transcripts with text.

max_output_size.text: Defaults to 2000. Max output size in tokens.

meta.description: Custom Summary allows you to distill a piece of audio into a few impactful sentences. You can give the model context to obtain more targeted results while outputting the results in a variety of formats described in human language.

questions.text: A list of questions to ask

input_text.text: Custom formatted transcript data. Maximum size is the context limit of the selected model

final_model.text: The model that is used for the final prompt after compression is performed.

temperature.text: The temperature to use for the model. Higher values result in answers that are more creative, lower values are more conservative.

transcript_ids.text: A list of completed transcripts with text.

max_output_size.text: Defaults to 2000. Max output size in tokens.

meta.description: Question & Answer allows you to ask free-form questions about a single transcript or a group of transcripts. The questions can be any whose answers you find useful, such as judging whether a caller is likely to become a customer or whether all items on a meeting’s agenda were covered.

input_text.text: Custom formatted transcript data. Maximum size is the context limit of the selected model

final_model.text: The model that is used for the final prompt after compression is performed.

temperature.text: The temperature to use for the model. Higher values result in answers that are more creative, lower values are more conservative.

answer_format.text: How you want the action items to be returned. This can be any text. Defaults to “Bullet Points”.

transcript_ids.text: A list of completed transcripts with text.

max_output_size.text: Defaults to 2000. Max output size in tokens.

meta.description: Use LeMUR to generate a list of action items from a transcript.

request_id.text: The ID of the LeMUR request you previously made. This would be found in the response of the original request.

meta.description: Retrieve a LeMUR response that was previously generated.

request_id.text: The ID of the LeMUR request you previously made. This would be found in the response of the original request.

meta.description: Delete the data for a previously submitted LeMUR request. The LLM response data, as well as any context provided in the original request will be removed.

assemblyai__/v2/realtime/token___POST.text: Create temporary authentication token for Streaming STT

expires_in.text: The amount of time until the token expires in seconds

meta.description: Create a temporary authentication token for Streaming Speech-to-Text.

token.text: Authenticate using a generated temporary token.

encoding.text: The encoding of the audio data. Defaults to pcm_s16le.

word_boost.text: Add up to 2500 characters of custom vocabulary.

sample_rate.text: The sample rate of the streamed audio.

disable_partial_transcripts.text: Set to true to not receive partial transcripts. Defaults to false.

enable_extra_session_information.text: Set to true to receive the SessionInformation message before the session ends. Defaults to false.

assemblyai__createatranscriptfromamediaf.provider_proxy_intent: Create a transcript from a media file that is accessible via a URL.

audio_url.text: The URL of the audio or video file to transcribe.

punctuate.text: Enable Automatic Punctuation, can be true or false

redact_pii.text: Redact PII from the transcribed text using the Redact PII model, can be true or false

word_boost.text: The list of custom vocabulary to boost transcription probability for

format_text.text: Enable Text Formatting, can be true or false

webhook_url.text: The URL to which we send webhook requests. We sends two different types of webhook requests. One request when a transcript is completed or failed, and one request when the redacted audio is ready if redact_pii_audio is enabled.

audio_end_at.text: The point in time, in milliseconds, to stop transcribing in your media file

disfluencies.text: Transcribe Filler Words, like “umm”, in your media file; can be true or false

dual_channel.text: Enable Dual Channel transcription, can be true or false.

multichannel.text: Enable Multichannel transcription, can be true or false.

speech_model.text: The speech model to use for the transcription.

summary_type.text: Allowed values: bullets bullets_verbose gist headline pargraph

auto_chapters.text: Enable Auto Chapters, can be true or false

custom_topics.text: Enable custom topics, either true or false

language_code.text: The language of your audio file. Possible values are found in Supported Languages. The default value is ‘en_us’.

summary_model.text: The model to summarize the transcript Allowed values: informative conversational catchy

content_safety.text: Enable Content Moderation, can be true or false

iab_categories.text: Enable Topic Detection, can be true or false

redact_pii_sub.text: The replacement logic for detected PII, can be “entity_name” or “hash”. See PII redaction for more details.

speaker_labels.text: Enable Speaker diarization, can be true or false

auto_highlights.text: Enable Key Phrases, either true or false

custom_spelling.text: Customize how words are spelled and formatted using to and from values

audio_start_from.text: The point in time, in milliseconds, to begin transcribing in your media file

entity_detection.text: Enable Entity Detection, can be true or false

filter_profanity.text: Filter profanity from the transcribed text, can be true or false

redact_pii_audio.text: Generate a copy of the original media file with spoken PII “beeped” out, can be true or false. See PII redaction for more details.

speech_threshold.text: Reject audio files that contain less than this fraction of speech. Valid values are in the range [0, 1] inclusive.

speakers_expected.text: Tells the speaker label model how many speakers it should attempt to identify, up to 10. See Speaker diarization for more details.

language_detection.text: Enable Automatic language detection, either true or false.

sentiment_analysis.text: Enable Sentiment Analysis, can be true or false

redact_pii_policies.text: The list of PII Redaction policies to enable. See PII redaction for more details.

redact_pii_audio_quality.text: Controls the filetype of the audio created by redact_pii_audio. Currently supports mp3 (default) and wav. See PII redaction for more details.

webhook_auth_header_name.text: The header name to be sent with the transcript completed or failed webhook requests

content_safety_confidence.text: The confidence threshold for the Content Moderation model. Values must be between 25 and 100.

webhook_auth_header_value.text: The header value to send back with the transcript completed or failed webhook requests for added security

language_confidence_threshold.text: The confidence threshold for the automatically detected language. An error will be returned if the language confidence is below this threshold. Defaults to 0.

meta.description: Create a transcript from a media file that is accessible via a URL.
meta.api_endpoint: Create a transcript from a media file that is accessible via a URL.
